title: Ghee & wine: Inside Delhi woman's 'fiery' plot to kill boyfriend; what was the motive?
content: A live-in relationship turned deadly as a 21-year-old woman, her ex-boyfriend, and his friend allegedly murdered her partner, a UPSC aspirant, in Delhi. They staged the crime as a fire incident to conceal the murder, driven by the victim's alleged possession of objectionable content. The trio has been arrested.

title: No SIR in Assam? Electoral rolls to be announced separately; EC explains why
content: The Election Commission will conduct a separate Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls in Assam due to unique legal provisions. Meanwhile, the second phase of SIR will cover 12 states and UTs, aiming to ensure accurate voter lists before upcoming polls.

title: Hack of the day: Flight delayed or cancelled? Get refund or compensation
content: Stranded due to flight disruptions in India? You're entitled to rights! Airlines must provide meals, refreshments, and even hotel stays for significant delays. For cancellations, expect refunds or rebooking options. Know your entitlements under the Passenger Charter and how to file a complaint via AirSewa to claim compensation up to ₹10,000.

title: TCS issues clarification: Don’t provide cybersecurity services to M&S
content: TCS has denied reports claiming Marks & Spencer terminated their contract following a £300 million cyberattack. The IT firm stated the report contained factual inaccuracies and that it does not provide cybersecurity services to M&S. TCS clarified that their service desk contract with M&S concluded prior to the April 2025 cyber incident through a competitive RFP process.

title: IND vs AUS: 'Stop!' India selectors given warning on Rohit and Virat selection
content: Former captain Krishnamachari Srikkanth urged the BCCI selectors to back Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli for the 2027 World Cup, emphasizing their fitness and recent performances. He advised clear communication, assuring the veterans of their importance and encouraging them to focus on staying fit to lead India to victory.

title: Ranji Trophy: Fastest! Prithvi Shaw sets 21st-century record with rare batting feat
content: Prithvi Shaw has etched his name in Ranji Trophy history by scoring the fastest double century in the 21st century, reaching the milestone in just 141 balls. This remarkable innings of 222 runs against Chandigarh places him alongside legends like Ravi Shastri and Virender Sehwag for his rapid scoring prowess in first-class cricket.

title: 'Flying Chernobyl': Russia now has nuclear-powered missile; what is Burevestnik?
content: Russia successfully tested its nuclear-powered Burevestnik cruise missile, a weapon President Putin claims can "pierce any defence shield." The test, conducted alongside a nuclear drill, signals Moscow's defiance against Western pressure over Ukraine. Putin announced the country will now move towards deploying the "invincible" missile, which reportedly traveled 14,000 kilometers.

title: MapmyIndia sends 'partner for India' request to Perplexity CEO Aravind Srinivas
content: MapmyIndia has invited Perplexity AI to collaborate, acknowledging the difficulty of recreating products like Google Maps. The Indian digital mapping company, with nearly three decades of experience building detailed maps of India, expressed its interest in partnering with Perplexity AI, drawing a parallel to its existing collaboration with Zoho.

title: Surya’s form a concern? Gambhir breaks silence: 'We’ve made a decision'
content: Head coach Gautam Gambhir backs T20I captain Suryakumar Yadav despite recent batting dips, emphasizing an ultra-aggressive team philosophy where failures are accepted. Gambhir prioritizes a fearless brand of cricket over individual scores, highlighting Suryakumar's leadership and a dressing room culture built on trust and freedom from the fear of losing.

title: Why is Joel Embiid out vs Orlando Magic? Latest update on 76ers star’s injury
content: Joel Embiid will sit out Monday's game against the Orlando Magic due to "injury management" for his left knee, a decision made to avoid risks on a back-to-back.  His playing time has been limited this season, and he expressed frustration with the short stints. Four other Sixers players are also sidelined with various injuries.

title: GM layoffs: Engineers fired on Microsoft Teams; Says it's business, not you
content: General Motors has let go of over 200 salaried employees, mainly CAD engineers, at its Michigan tech campus. This move, part of a restructuring to boost profits, follows strong third-quarter earnings and a raised financial outlook. GM stated the layoffs target execution roles to enhance core design capabilities. This comes as the automotive sector sees broader workforce reductions.

title: Whose gold is it? Wife’s Rs 1.65cr jewellery seized; husband moves ITAT & wins - explained
content: The Income Tax Appellate Tribunal ruled in favor of a taxpayer, stating that gold jewelry seized during a search could not be treated as unexplained investment in his hands. The Tribunal noted that the same assets were already declared and accepted in his wife's tax assessment, making a separate addition legally baseless.

title: UP's Mustafabad to be renamed? What CM Yogi said
content: In a move to honor cultural heritage, Uttar Pradesh's Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath declared the renaming of Mustafabad village in Lakhimpur Kheri to 'Kabirdham'. This decision seeks to revive the legacy of Sant Kabir, particularly underscoring the village's historical significance regardless of its current demographics. Adityanath's announcement aligns with other similar renaming efforts aimed at restoring the region's cultural roots.

title: Asia Cup handshake row: J&K CM bats for 'spirit of the game' - 'why not?'
content: Jammu and Kashmir CM Omar Abdullah expressed disappointment that the Indian cricket team did not shake hands with Pakistan's Salman Ali Agha's side during the Asia Cup. He emphasized playing in the spirit of the game and advocated for resuming bilateral cricket ties between the two nations.

title: Gainfully 'employed': Rajasthan Officer ‘pays salaries’ to wife for fake jobs
content: Jaipur's anti-corruption bureau has filed a case against a senior IT department officer, Pradhyuman Dixit, for allegedly orchestrating illegal salary payments to his wife, Poonam Dixit, through two private firms. Over Rs 30 lakh was deposited into her accounts between 2019 and 2020, despite her never working for the companies. Authorities suspect these payments were bribes for IT contract favors.

title: Shreyas Iyer still in ICU after dangerously low body vitals, internal bleeding
content: Indian cricketer Shreyas Iyer is currently in the ICU of a Sydney hospital following a serious fall during the third ODI against Australia. Reports indicate he experienced dangerously low body vitals post-incident and was immediately hospitalized in a critical, life-threatening condition. His recovery is ongoing.

title: Joe Alwyn’s old moment with Taylor Swift sparks outrage as fans hail Travis Kelce
content: Taylor Swift's upcoming wedding to Travis Kelce has fans buzzing, especially after a resurfaced clip from 2022 showing her with ex Joe Alwyn sparked outrage.  Fans criticized Alwyn's apparent rush to avoid paparazzi, contrasting it with Kelce's public support for Swift's success.  The couple remains private about their wedding details.

title: Major update on Tom Aspinall following shocking eye poke spot at UFC 321
content: UFC 321's main event concluded controversially when Tom Aspinall was accidentally eye-poked by Ciryl Gane, rendering him unable to continue. Aspinall later shared an update, expressing significant concern about his eye injury, stating it's scarier than his previous knee injury. He has returned to England for further medical evaluation.

title: 'Attack' on CJI: Why SC refused to act against accused lawyer; will set up norms
content: The Supreme Court acknowledged shoe-hurling as contempt but declined action against the lawyer, citing potential glorification. The SCBA president criticized this, deeming it a joke on the institution. The apex court will instead issue guidelines on social media conduct and the glorification of such incidents.

title: iPhones boom, Trump sanctions impact: Electronics to become 2nd-most exported
content: India's electronics exports are surging, driven by booming iPhone production, and are projected to become the second-largest export category. This rise coincides with a potential decline in oil exports due to US sanctions on Russian crude, impacting refiners' purchases and eliminating price advantages.

title: Kolkata: Mob of 50 led by auto driver storms flat, assaults customs officer, wife
content: A customs inspector and his wife were brutally assaulted in their Kolkata home by a mob of 50, led by an auto driver, after a minor traffic altercation. Police, reportedly busy with Kali Puja immersions, arrived late, allowing most attackers to escape. Arrested individuals were quickly granted bail, sparking resident fears.

title: 'No one can compete with us': Tej Pratap says Mahua backing JJD; vows to work for Bihar
content: Janshakti Janata Dal (JJD) chief Tej Pratap Yadav expressed strong confidence ahead of the Bihar elections, asserting massive support in his Mahua constituency and claiming no one can compete with his party. He emphasized that voters will decide the next government and highlighted his party's agenda of development and public welfare.

title: Gold rate today below Rs 1.23 lakh per 10 grams. what’s the outlook?
content: Gold and silver prices saw a dip in early trading as investors booked profits after a recent rally and market fluctuations. Geopolitical tensions and upcoming US Fed policy meeting influenced traders to reduce positions at higher price points. Investors are now awaiting key US CPI data for further market direction.

title: UP highway horror: Sleeper bus gutted on Agra-Lucknow Expressway
content: A Delhi-Gonda sleeper bus caught fire early Sunday on the Agra-Lucknow Expressway. Driver Jagat Singh and aides Shyam Sundar and Manish swiftly evacuated all 39 passengers. Their quick thinking and brave actions prevented any loss of life. The bus was completely gutted before fire services arrived. Passengers praised the trio's courage.

title: 'Technical snag': Dubai-bound flight from Madurai diverted; no injuries reported
content: A Dubai-bound private jet from Madurai made an emergency landing in Chennai on Sunday due to a mid-air technical issue. The aircraft, carrying 160 passengers, landed safely without any reported injuries. This diversion follows a similar incident involving a SpiceJet flight returning to Delhi shortly after departure, also due to technical problems.

title: Bad air: Diwali AQI was near ‘severe’ had data not gone missing
content: Diwali's vibrant celebrations took a somber turn as Delhi's air quality monitoring infrastructure faced an unprecedented breakdown on the festive night and the subsequent morning.

title: Molestation row: Wife of star Australia cricketer takes a jibe — 'Police escort...'
content: Australian cricketer Ashleigh Gardner and her wife playfully highlighted India's security after an incident where two national players were allegedly molested in Indore.  Following the unsettling event, police provided an escort, prompting a humorous social media post.  Authorities swiftly apprehended the suspect in the earlier case.

title: How French police caught Louvre museum heist suspects
content: French authorities have arrested two suspects in connection with the Louvre's crown jewels heist. The arrests followed an analysis of forensic evidence, including DNA and fingerprints, and surveillance footage. One suspect was apprehended at the airport attempting to flee the country.

title: SC pulls up Delhi police on bail pleas of Umar Khalid, 3 others; next hearing on Friday
content: The Supreme Court on Monday adjourned the hearing on the bail pleas of activists Umar Khalid, Sharjeel Imam, and others in the Delhi riots UAPA case until October 31. The court granted time to the Delhi Police to file a reply after the Additional Solicitor General sought a two-week extension.

title: Watch: Desi mom hires band to wake up her kids; video wins internet
content: A creative Indian mother's attempt to wake her children with a dhol band went viral, showcasing a unique parenting tactic. Despite the loud music, the kids remained unfazed, pulling blankets over their heads.  Internet was quick to react to the heartwarming video that sparked amusement and debate online, highlighting a playful approach to morning routines.

title: Emiru-Mizkif controversy: How Twitch star’s breakup led to assault claims
content: Twitch streamer Emiru publicly accused ex-boyfriend Mizkif of sexual assault, emotional abuse, stalking, and blackmail threats. She detailed disturbing past threats and a new warning sign at TwitchCon 2025, prompting her to speak out for her safety. Mizkif admitted to toxic fights but denied assault, while Emiru is pursuing restraining orders.

title: Blink and it's gone: China unveils world's fastest train
content: China's new CR450 bullet train has set a world speed record, reaching 453 km/h during testing. This innovative train, capable of accelerating to 350 km/h in under five minutes, is set to enter commercial service by 2026. The advanced design, featuring a streamlined nose cone, solidifies China's leadership in high-speed rail.

title: BJP MLA Ravi Negi falls into Yamuna during reel shoot on cleanup drive
content: BJP MLA Ravi Negi's reel shoot in Yamuna turned dramatic as he fell in, thankfully unhurt. Meanwhile, AAP accused BJP of creating a "fake" Yamuna ghat with filtered water for PM Modi, while devotees face pollution. BJP countered, calling AAP's claims "political frustration" and highlighting their efforts to clean ghats.

title: Janhvi Kapoor stuns in a 20-yr-old vintage dress priced at staggering Rs 5 lakh - pics
content: Janhvi Kapoor flaunted a vibrant, archival yellow printed mini dress that was not only a lesson vintage glamour but also came with an equally staggering price tag. Read on to learn more about Janhvi Kapoor's timeless yet luxe fashion moment right here.

title: SA name 15-man squad for India Tests; Bavuma to captain
content: South Africa has unveiled its 15-member squad for the upcoming Test series in India, with captain Temba Bavuma returning after injury.  The Proteas have made minimal changes, banking on a blend of seasoned players and emerging talent to tackle the challenging subcontinental conditions.  This series presents a significant opportunity for South Africa to break their winless streak on Indian soil.

title: Delhi weather: Sunny skies, no rain; AQI remains very poor
content: New Delhi enjoys a sunny and pleasant Monday with temperatures reaching 31.7°C, ideal for outdoor plans. However, air quality remains a concern, with yesterday's AQI at 281 (Very Poor) due to high pollutants. While today's weather might slightly disperse pollutants, masks are advised for traffic-heavy areas. The week ahead promises mostly clear skies, except for Tuesday's potential rain.

title: I-T withheld Rs 1.5 cr refund citing TDS mismatch - how taxpayer approached HC & won
content: Taxpayers facing refund delays due to TDS mismatches in Form 26AS have a reason to cheer. A recent Allahabad High Court ruling mandates tax authorities to accept taxpayer-provided TDS documentation, like Form 16A, for verification. This decision prevents Assessing Officers from arbitrarily withholding legitimate refunds, shifting the verification burden to them.

title: Delhi horror: MBBS student invited to 'hotel party', drugged, raped and filmed: accused flees
content: An 18-year-old MBBS student was allegedly raped and blackmailed by a 20-year-old man at a Delhi hotel. The accused reportedly drugged and sexually assaulted her, with associates helping to take compromising photos and videos for coercion. A case has been registered under the Bharatiya Nyay Samhita.

title: Iyer in ICU: Family could fly to Sydney soon, BCCI making arrangements
content: Indian cricketer Shreyas Iyer is hospitalized in Sydney following a fall during an ODI against Australia. He is in the ICU due to internal bleeding from a spleen laceration and is being closely monitored. The BCCI is arranging for his family to join him as he recovers, with his condition stable but requiring continued observation.

title: 3I/ ATLAS could uncover the universe’s greatest mystery by October 30
content: Renowned physicist Michio Kaku predicts astronomers may soon determine if interstellar object 3I/ATLAS is natural or artificial. By late October 2025, its solar encounter could reveal unusual energy gains, hinting at intelligent guidance. This potential discovery, reminiscent of 'Oumuamua, could be the first tangible sign of extraterrestrial technology, redefining humanity's cosmic place.

title: Pilots' Body Urges Withdrawal Of Extended Boeing 787 Flight Duty Hours
content: India's aviation regulator has allowed an extension of flight duty hours for select Boeing 787 Dreamliner routes, a move that has drawn sharp criticism from the country's pilots' association, citing serious safety and fatigue concerns.

title: "It's Too Cute": Trump Will Not Run For Vice President To Stay In Power
content: Donald Trump said on Monday that he would not run for vice president in the 2028 American election, a move some supporters suggest would allow him to skirt term limits and stay in the White House.

title: Row After Bangladesh Map On Yunus' Gift To Pak Official Shows Indian Regions
content: A gift from Bangladesh's Chief Advisor to the interim government to Pakistan's General Sahir Shamshad Mirza, has stirred a row.

title: Exclusive: India's Latest China Headache: 36 Hardened Aircraft Shelters Near Arunachal
content: China has completed the construction of 36 hardened aircraft shelters at Lhunze, about 107 kilometres from the strategic town of Tawang in Arunachal Pradesh.

title: Cyber Cops Unearth Rs 48 Crore, Foreign Hackers, Dubai Links Under Probe
content: Bengaluru Cyber Crime Police have arrested two individuals for allegedly hacking into Whizdm Finance Pvt Ltd bank accounts and siphoning off nearly Rs 48 crore using foreign IP addresses.

title: Mustafabad To Be Renamed Kabirdham? UP Government's New Proposal
content: UP Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath said his government will move a proposal to rename Mustafabad village as 'Kabirdham', asserting that the change would restore the area's historical and cultural identity linked with Sant Kabir

title: Dubai-Bound SpiceJet Flight Diverted To Chennai After 'Technical Issue'
content: A Dubai-bound SpiceJet flight from Madurai was diverted here on Monday following a "technical issue", airport sources and the airline said.

title: Electoral Roll Revision In Bengal, Tamil Nadu But Not Assam? Election Commission Explains Why
content: Phase Two of the nationwide rollout of voter roll revision -- an exercise being undertaken after 21 years -- includes two states where assembly elections are due next year. But there is a third which is not included.

title: From Inhaler To Purifier: How Residents Are Surviving Delhi-NCR's Toxic Air
content: Thirty-five-year-old Rekha Sharma, a resident of Nehru Place, leaves for work early in the morning for Noida, masked up and with an inhaler in her bag.

title: 2 Killed After Heavy Rain In Kerala, Orange Alert Issued In 5 Districts
content: Heavy rain accompanied by strong winds lashed several districts across Kerala on Monday, causing waterlogging in low-lying areas, officials said.

title: 9 Years After Dhaka Attack, Why Bangladesh Is Welcoming Zakir Naik Now
content: Following the 2016 Dhaka Holey Artisan Bakery terror attack, the Sheikh Hasina government had banned Zakir Naik's Peace TV. The decision was taken after one of the attackers had said that he and his associates were inspired by the rabid speeches made

title: "Given Enough Time": Top Court Raps Delhi Cops In Umar Khalid Bail Hearing
content: The Supreme Court today pulled up the Delhi Police for not filing a response to bail petitions by Umar Khalid, Sharjeel Imam, and others accused in the 2020 Delhi riots case.

title: "Is This Gandhiji?" Controversial 'Abstract' Statue in Kerala Sparks Uproar
content: An unveiling of a Mahatma Gandhi statue in Kerala has sparked widespread shock and debate, with locals complaining that it looks nothing like the most revered figure in India's freedom struggle.

title: Why October 29 Is Key To Solving The Mystery Of Comet 3I/ATLAS
content: NASA's Hubble, Webb, Parker Solar Probe, and other missions are tracking 3I/ATLAS to understand its true nature.

title: In Delhi Acid Attack Case, Cops Find Big Holes In Survivor's Account
content: A day after a college student was hospitalised with burns she suffered in an alleged acid attack in northwest Delhi, investigators say the allegations are "suspicious" and that they have not yet found any concrete evidence that establishes the charge

title: Woman's Revenge, Ex's Support, And Some Ghee: Story Behind A Charred Body
content: Three weeks after a 32-year-old civil services aspirant's charred body was recovered after a fire in north Delhi's Timarpur, cops have uncovered a chilling murder conspiracy executed with precision.

title: All About Justice Surya Kant, Set To Take Over As Country's Top Judge
content: Justice Surya Kant was part of the Supreme Court bench that heard former Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal's CBI case linked to the Delhi liquor policy.

title: Behind Pak's Civilian Facade, Asim Munir's Deep-State Consolidation Of Power
content: Asim Munir has already changed some top corps commanders to ensure that there would be no seniority issues.

title: "Kashmir Sings Back Voice Of Truth": NDTV Good Times Displays Valley's Spirit
content: NDTV Good Times 'Music and Freedom' concert was held at the Sher-i-Kashmir International Conference Centre (SKICC) by the Dal Lake in Srinagar.

title: LSU fires Kelly, still finalizing his $54M buyout
content: A day after a 49-25 loss to Texas A&M in Baton Rouge, LSU fired coach Brian Kelly on Sunday night, with athletic director Scott Woodward announcing in a statement that "we had high hopes that he would lead us to multiple SEC and national championships."

title: Love outduels Rodgers as Pack tout 'the successor'
content: With former Green Bay quarterback Aaron Rodgers watching from the sidelines, Jordan Love showed just how much he learned from his predecessor en route to the Packers' impressive 35-25 victory over the Steelers on Sunday night in Pittsburgh.

title: Orioles tab Albernaz as next manager, sources say
content: The Baltimore Orioles are finalizing a deal to hire former Guardians associate manager Craig Albernaz, sources told ESPN on Sunday.

title: Flagg ignites Mavericks' offense in first NBA win
content: Mavericks rookie Cooper Flagg became the fifth-youngest player in NBA history to score at least 20 points in his first NBA win Sunday.

title: Reaves nets career-high 51 for Luka-less Lakers
content: Austin Reaves scored a career-high 51 points in leading the short-handed Lakers past the Kings on Sunday night without Luka Doncic.

title: After emotional week, Fields helps Jets stun Cincy
content: Justin Fields helped the Jets stage one of the biggest comebacks in franchise history, stunning the Bengals on Sunday.

title: Giants 'devastated' after Skattebo dislocates ankle
content: Giants rookie running back Cam Skattebo was carted off the field Sunday because of a gruesome right ankle injury.

title: Jerry skeptical Dallas is '1 player away on defense'
content: Following the Cowboys' blowout loss to the Broncos on Sunday, owner and GM Jerry Jones indicated he is willing to engage on a trade but isn't convinced the team's defense is "one player away" from being competitive.

title: Barnwell makes sense of a blowout-filled Week 8: One key takeaway from each of Sunday's 11 games
content: Ten of Sunday's 11 games were two-score wins -- not super exciting. But we still found something fun in every matchup, including some RB takeovers.

title: Justin Fields won't get benched? Myles Garrett is DPOY? Let's overreact to Week 8
content: We sized up Week 8 overreactions, including fantasy. Is Fields on more solid ground? Will Garrett be the DPOY?

title: The 4 teams currently playing like national champions -- and why
content: After nine weeks of twists and turns, these teams are at the head of the class -- at least for the time being.

title: 'Monday Night Football' moments for all 32 NFL teams, including one we'd rather forget
content: Dazzling plays, huge comebacks and one notable injury punctuated the first 55 years of "Monday Night Football."

title: Why a team that was one win from a Super Bowl is wallowing in third place in NFC East
content: With Jayden Daniels set to miss his third game on Monday night, Washington is off to an unexpectedly slow start.

title: Much more than just Vlad and Springer: Meet the Blue Jays' under-the-radar mashers
content: Toronto is a tough out from top to bottom. Here are five guys you need to know who help lengthen the lineup.

title: Bullpen woes, L.A.'s offensive troubles, Toronto's power: What we've learned so far
content: With the World Series resuming in Los Angeles, we break down what we've seen so far -- and what to expect.

title: Scenes from the ultimate FCS grudge match: North Dakota State against South Dakota State
content: The top-2 FCS teams, and winners of 12 of the past 14 national titles, met in one of the country's fiercest rivalries.

title: Real Madrid enjoy statement Clásico win; Liverpool lose again; more
content: Sunday's Clasico was a blockbuster, though Barca may regret sending Lamine Yamal out pre-game to rile up Madrid. PLUS: What Liverpool's fourth straight league loss means, drama for Inter at Napoli, and more.

title: 15 games, 4 leagues, plenty of props: How bettors view the sports equinox
content: Mondays in October have had some of the best betting action all year, and now the NBA enters the mix.

title: World Series and MNF, plus NBA, NHL and more showdowns
content: Celebrate the sports equinox with the World Series, 'Monday Night Football,' NBA and NHL as the headliners.

title: Trae Young is ready to silence his haters
content: The Hawks had a busy offseason that included surrounding Young with star power. Can he claim the wide-open East and prove he's worth a max deal?

title: Who's got next? Predicting five breakout players for this season
content: Which NBA players are primed to take the next step in their development? Jeremy Woo predicts the top five.

title: Moultrie & Co. get Hayes' team back playing 'the USA way'
content: For a team that prides itself on playing "the USA way," Sunday's 3-1 win over Portugal was a good response to Thursday's shock loss.

title: Week 8 winners and losers: Taylor and Cook deliver; CMC and Robinson fall flat
content: Jonathan Taylor, James Cook III and Saquon Barkley led the way with big Week 8 performances, while Christian McCaffrey, Bijan Robinson and Caleb Williams were among the biggest disappointments.

title: Buzz: Giants lose Skattebo, Bigsby steps up for Eagles
content: Cam Skattebo's ankle injury and Tank Bigsby stepping up for Philadelphia are among the top fantasy storylines.

title: How Norris rediscovered F1 title 'favorite' tag in Mexico
content: Lando Norris hasn't been F1's title favorite for some time, but his Mexico win puts him atop the standings.

title: Byron, Larson get last spots in NASCAR title finale
content: William Byron won at Martinsville Speedway in the third-round finale of the NASCAR Cup Series playoffs, while Kyle Larson sealed the final Championship 4 spot on points.

title: NFL draft risers, questions and notes: What to make of big games from Ty Simpson, Anthony Hill Jr.
content: Could Ty Simpson be the QB1? Is Anthony Hill Jr. climbing the LB ranks again? We have notes on NFL prospects through CFB Week 9.

title: Two F's and an incomplete make for a woeful UFC 321 report card
content: Following a disappointing ending during the main event between Tom Aspinall and Ciryl Gane at UFC 321, Andreas Hale gives a letter grade for every fight on the card.

title: Red-hot Michael Brennan wins in Utah for first tour title
content: Michael Brennan was just as dominant at Black Desert as he was on the PGA Tour Americas. He closed with a 5-under 66 to go from a sponsor exemption to a PGA Tour winner Sunday with his four-shot victory in the Bank of Utah Championship.

title: X-ray tables, marked cards and the Mafia: How the FBI says poker games were rigged
content: Details of how poker games, some involving Chauncey Billups, were allegedly rigged to make people lose big.

title: WWE 'SmackDown' highlights: McIntyre heats up title match against Rhodes
content: Friday's "SmackDown" set up a perfect "Saturday Night's Main Event," with Drew McIntyre and Cody Rhodes ready for the challenge.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Ratcliffe blocks Man United move for Lewandowski
content: Manchester United minority owner Sir Jim Ratcliffe has blocked a shock move for Barcelona striker Robert Lewandowski. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Yadgir farmers demand immediate relief for crop lost to torrential rain
content: Standing crops in over a lakh hectares of agricultural land have been completely destroyed owing to copious rainfall, according to them

title: Open houses by Anantapur, Kurnool and Nandyal police enthrals students
content: Consider police as your family and approach them for any assistance or redressal of problems. We are here to serve you, says Anantapur SP

title: Water Resources Minister directs irrigation officials to stay on high alert in cyclone-affected districts
content: Ramanaidu tells  them to ensure all gates, sluices, and canals are clear of obstructions, keep essential equipment ready, and issue advance warnings to low-lying areas to prevent loss of life and property

title: Geneticist K. Thangaraj of CSIR-CCMB awarded Rashtriya Vigyan Puraskar
content: A scientist at CSIR-CCMB, Hyderabad, he has spent over three decades studying population genetics and medical genomics

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: T.N. gets new Sainik School in Namakkal district
content: This brings the number of schools in the State for the consideration of candidates appearing in the AISSEE 2026 to 5

title: We must continue to introspect; remain prepared for war-like situation: Rajnath
content: The Defence Minister said the effective use of indigenously manufactured military equipment during the May 7-10 operation bolstered India's reputation both regionally and internationally

title: Gear up the entire machinery to handle heavy rain, disaster risk reduction agency tells  officials
content: It has instructed the Greater Chennai Corporation and the Collectors of Chennai, Chengalpattu,  Kancheepuram, Tiruvallur, and Ranipet districts to adhere to the Standard Operating Procedures for handling disasters

title: SC issues notice to Madhya Pradesh, HC registry on plea for enhancing retirement age of judges
content: The judges’ body has assailed an administrative decision of the Madhya Pradesh High Court declining to increase the retirement age despite clear directions from the apex court earlier this year

title: Declare Zubeen Garg’s final film tax-free: Assam Congress
content: All first-day tickets for Roi Roi Binale to be shown on 90 screens across the State have been pre-booked, a member of the production team said

title: Karnataka Transport Minister Ramalinga Reddy flags poor performance of e-bus operators in Bengaluru
content: The lack of structured driver training, poor vehicle maintenance, and reduced manpower deployment as low as 1.9  to 2.0 employees per bus against the required 2.3 have led to service disruptions and a spike in accidents

title: Mysuru tiger attack: Forest Minister Eshwar Khandre faces farmers’ ire
content: Expressing their outrage over recurring human-animal conflict in Mysuru region, farmers accused the forest department staff of dereliction of duty and demanded a permanent solution to the issue.

title: Union Minister George Kurian to lay foundation stone for new academic block at Central University of Kerala
content: Union Ministry of Minority Affairs allocates ₹52.68 crore for project under the Pradhan Mantri Jan Vikas Karyakram

title: TVK president Vijay meets families of Karur stampede victims in Mamallapuram a month after tragedy
content: Some of the family members who The Hindu spoke to said Mr. Vijay met each family individually and offered his condolences

title: Government clears seven projects under electronics component scheme
content: Approved projects entail a cumulative investment of ₹5,532 crore, projects are likely to generate employment for 5,195 people, says IT Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw

title: BJP doesn't need ‘crutches’ in Maharashtra, says Amit Shah
content: Referring to the 'double engine' government of the BJP at the Centre and in the State, Mr. Shah said the party must also secure victories in the local body polls scheduled later this year, instructing workers to "work so hard that the Opposition is wiped out

title: Jaishankar meets New Zealand Prime Minister Christopher Luxon, Malaysian counterpart on ASEAN sidelines
content: The two Foreign Ministers discussed the "progress in our bilateral cooperation”. They also exchanged views on the Myanmar situation, says S. Jaishankar

title: South Coastal Andhra Pradesh prepares for Cyclone Montha
content: The cyclone is moving west and north-westwards, likely to intensify into a cyclonic storm by October 28 morning

title: Cyclonic storm Montha triggers rain in Kerala, yellow alert for seven districts on October 28
content: Parts of the State are likely to experience isolated heavy to very heavy rainfall on Monday night and Tuesday

title: Phase two of SIR of electoral rolls in 12 States, UTs from November 4
content: CEC Gyanesh Kumar said phase-II of SIR in 12 States/UTs to cover 51 crore voters and the enumeration process to begin on November 4; final electoral rolls will be published on February 7.

title: Poet and lyricist Vayalar Ramavarma remembered on his 50th death anniversary
content: At Chandrakalabham in Raghavaparambu—where his memories rest, Vayalar memorial events and poetry gatherings were held. As part of the anniversary of the Punnapra-Vayalar uprising, the Vayalar Ramavarma Memorial Literary conference was organised

title: Cyclone Montha: IMD issues yellow alert for 11 districts in Karnataka
content: Uttara Kannada, Udupi, Dakshina Kannada, Bidar, Kalaburgi, Yadgir, Vijayapura, Bagalkot, Raichur, Koppal and Gadag districts are likely to receive heavy rainfall on October 27 and 28.

title: Cyclone Montha: List of trains cancelled at Visakhapatnam
content: The passengers are asked to check with the respective railway enquiry offices or the official website for the latest updates

title: Twin agreements signed for renovation of stadium in preparation of Argentina match
content: The international friendly match featuring the Lionel Messi-led World Champion Argentina now remains cancelled. Sponsor says renovation work will continue as planned and that the stadium will be handed back to the GCDA as agreed

title: Himachal Cabinet decides to double terms of Mayors, Deputy Mayors to five years
content: The decision will benefit the Mayor and Deputy Mayor of Shimla Municipal Corporation, whose two-and-a-half-year term is expiring in November 2025, says officials

title: Vessel 'Sindhu' completes maiden round trip to India's only active volcano in Andamans
content: The vessel 'Sindhu', with a carrying capacity of 500 passengers, sailed almost at full capacity, including 125 government school students drawn from different parts of the archipelago, says officials

title: Andhra Pradesh High Court orders CID probe into theft of money offered to the Tirumala temple
content: The theft from the Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanam’s coffers took place during the counting process (Parakamani) in 2023. Later, the issue was settled by those involved in the Lok Adalat, Tirupati

title: ECI announces phase 2 of Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls in 12 States | LIVE
content: Printing of Enumeration Forms will begin on October 28 and would be given to each voter in States where SIR would take place now.

title: Dharmasthala case: SIT asked to submit probe report by October end, says Home Minister Parameshwara
content: The final report would include an FSL analysis of the bones found during excavation as well as a chemical analysis report.

title: Kerala authorises district-level biodiversity committees to declare ‘official species’ for protection
content: Move seeks to ensure legal protection and promote conservation efforts rooted in local knowledge and participation

title: Arunachal IAS officer, accused in teen’s death, surrenders
content: An Executive Engineer in the State’s Rural Works Department, also named in the 19-year-old’s handwritten notes, was found dead a few days ago

title: 616 fishing boats from Kakinada have reached the shores, says Municipal Administration Minister P. Narayana
content: One thousand personnel have arrived from Rayalaseema region for electricity restoration after Cyclone Montha makes landfall

title: Dubai-bound private flight diverted to Chennai following ‘technical snag’
content: The “snag” was detected mid-air and the flight with 160 passengers subsequently landed safely at the airport here, sources said

title: Cyclone Montha: Evacuation of nearly 10,000 people begins in Konaseema
content: As many as 126 pregnant women, whose delivery date is expected within a fortnight, have been shifted to nearby hospitals along the coastline in Konaseema

title: 19-year-old Lakshadweep's Mubassina conquers odds to stake claim as a rising talent
content: Mubassina Mohammed became first international athlete from the Union Territory and is fast emerging as a top long jumper in India

title: Over 2,200 runners participate in 'Sikkim Soldierthon' Marathon
content: The marathon was flagged off by Mizoram Governor General V.K. Singh (retired) in the presence of Sikkim Governor Om Prakash Mathur at the Paljor stadium

title: Frame draft SOP for political meetings, rallies in Tamil Nadu within 10 days: Madras High Court
content: Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava and Justice G. Arul Murugan direct Tamil Nadu government to place the draft SOP before the court on November 11, 2025

title: DMK and Congress sail together in the interest of nation, says T.N. CM Stalin
content: The Chief Minister said though the DMK and the Congress had travelled on different paths in the past, they were now journeying together on a path dedicated to the interest of the nation, the development of Tamil Nadu, and above all, the unity of India

title: Supreme Court prefers ignoring attack against CJI with contempt it deserves; SC Bar Association disagrees
content: Justice Kant favoured condemning the incident of hurling an object at the CJI to a ‘natural death’, SCBA insisted the judicial institution should not risk becoming a ‘joke’ by letting Rakesh Kishore go without repercussions

title: Cyclone Montha: Panic buying at rythu bazaars in Vijayawada
content: Keeping in view the possibility of isolated very heavy to extremely heavy rain for three days, the NTR district administration had earlier advised people to stock up on essentials

title: Cyclone Montha: special officer reviews preparedness at Vizag
content: Special officer Ajay Jain says, ‘We have told the officials to stock up an adequate quantity of food and water to supply to shelter homes and also to the general public if required.’

title: Uproar in J&K Assembly over AAP MLA's detention under PSA
content: NC MLA from Banihal, Sajjad Shaheen, demanded a one-hour discussion on the Doda MLA's detention last month under the stringent act

title: Rajeev Chandrasekhar accuses Kerala govt of propaganda over claims of eradicating extreme poverty
content: BJP Kerala president says reduction in poverty in State is ‘due to schemes sponsored by Union government’

title: Vodafone Idea wins relief in Supreme Court as Centre agrees to reconsider additional AGR dues
content: The top court found nothing wrong in the government’s stand to reconsider its demand for additional AGR dues for the financial year (FY) 2016-2017 from the company and take a suitable decision

title: All MLAs must unite for daily wage workers’ regularisation in J&K: Mehbooba Mufti
content: The former Chief Minister of the erstwhile state said the workers, often from the most marginalised sections of society, have been the backbone of many government departments, ensuring their smooth functioning

title: Cylone Montha: Vizag gears up to handle the storm
content: Although cyclone Montha is unlikely to hit the Visakhapatnam coast like the 2014 cyclone Hudhud, residents have started to stockpile food and essentials, anticipating disruptions

title: ‘Digital arrests’ are happening in several States, people are running from pillar to post: Supreme Court
content: The fraudsters posed as judges and police officers using forged documents; the Bench issued notice to all the States and the Union Territories, directing them to provide details of pending FIRs and ‘cyber arrests’ that had been reported in their jurisdictions

title: Orange alert issued in north Tamil Nadu districts as Cyclone Montha advances
content: In its Nowcast till 1 p.m. on Monday (October 27), the RMC has predicted moderate rains to continue over Chennai and its neighbouring districts, and Villupuram and Ranipet

title: Two CPI(M) activists arrested during campaign in Bengaluru
content: Both are members of CPI(M) IT Front local committee, and Adiga is the general secretary of Karnataka State IT/ITeS Employees Union

title: Thuingaleng Muivah’s homecoming: Where a Manipur village rekindles hope for Naga peace process
content: More than 60 years after he walked out to join the Naga movement that called for a separation from India in 1964, NSCN (I-M) general secretary Thuingaleng Muivah returned to Somdal, his birthplace in Manipur’s Ukhrul district for eight days. His homecoming rekindled hope for a settlement of the Naga peace process hanging fire for almost three decades and signalled a move for reconciliation in the ethnically volatile State

title: Stray dogs case: Supreme Court pulls up States, UTs over non-compliance with order, summons Chief Secretaries
content: The top court ordered the Chief Secretaries of all States and Union Territories, barring West Bengal and Telangana, to appear before it on November 3

title: Cyclone Montha likely to bring heavy rainfall in Kerala; orange alert for three districts
content: An orange alert warning of very heavy rainfall has been issued for three districts – Kozhikode, Kannur and Kasaragod – on Monday, while the rest of the State, except for Thiruvananthapuram and Kollam, has been put on yellow alert

title: Bihar Assembly polls: Kharge, Rahul, Priyanka among Congress’ 40-star campaigners
content: Senior leaders Ashok Gehlot, Tariq Anwar, Gaurav Gogoi, Mohammad Jawed, and Akhilesh Prasad Singh are also on the list

title: Law student brutally attacked after argument with shop owner in Kanpur, three arrested
content: Three persons, including the shop owner, have been arrested for the attack search is underway for a fourth accused, they said

title: Eminent plastic surgeon K. Mathangi Ramakrishnan no more
content: She established the plastic surgery department and burns unit at Government Kilpauk Medical College, Chennai — one of the foremost government centres in India dedicated to comprehensive burn care and rehabilitation

title: GCDA questions ₹70-crore stadium upgrade claim ahead of Argentina football match in Kerala
content: Greater Cochin Development Authority chairman says three-member monitoring committee will assess scope of work and determine actual costs involved

title: Cyclone Montha: 269 rehabilitation centres open along the Kakinada coast
content: As many as 59 rehabilitation centres have been opened along the Uppada coast, where fisherfolk are vulnerable to cyclones and coastal erosion

title: Delhi riots case hearing highlights: SC defers to October 31 hearing on bail pleas of Umar Khalid, Sharjeel Imam and others
content: Delhi High Court on September 2 denied bail to nine people, including Khalid and Imam, saying “conspiratorial” violence under the garb of demonstrations or protests by citizens could not be allowed

title: VAR review: Was Sunderland's goal offside? Did Gakpo deserve a penalty?
content: Janusz Michallik reacts to sunderland's 2-1 defeat in the premier league . the video assistant referee causes controversy every week in the Premier league, but how are decisions made and are they correct? we take a look at the major incidents to examine and explain the process in terms of VAR protocol and the Laws of the Game .

title: Projecting the CFP top 12 after Week 9: Vandy's in the field!
content: Vanderbilt Commodores is on the brink of making its first appearance in any CFP ranking during the playoff era . if the playoff were today, they would already be in the top 12 when the first ranking is released Nov. 4 . there's a chance to make their debut in the coveted top 12 .

title: Ranking 80 men's NCAA basketball teams by March Madness potential
content: some of the following teams will be in a different tier by the end of 2025-26 . there are also teams with second-weekend potential that could fall to the bubble . auburn has lost a lot of talent and a head coach .

title: How the matchups line up for all 46 postseason games
content: all four of those teams are in the mix for the college football Playoff . the five highest-ranked conference champions, plus the next seven highest-rated teams, will make the field . last season's inaugural 12-team CFP, the five most-ranked conferences champions will be awarded first-round byes .

title: Wetzel: As bad as this is, the next betting scandal is coming
content: almost every sports league, team and operation wants in on sports wagering revenue . sponsorships, partnerships. advertising. maybe it's direct payments . sports is awash in gambling cash . more than 30 people were arrested, including big shots .

title: Week 9 Power Rankings: Top 5 stays consistent; Houston and Utah join the list
content: Ole Miss' road win against Oklahoma makes the Rebels a virtual lock for the playoff . deion Sanders summed it up after watching his team give up 587 yards of offense in a 53-7 loss to Utah . "this is probably the worst beating I've ever had except when my momma whooped me as a kid," Sanders said .

title: 🚘 Eagles' revenge on Giants leads NFL trolls
content: the Philadelphia Eagles defeated the New York Giants 38-20 at home . the Eagles signal-caller had 179 passing yards and four touchdowns . trolls poke fun at the "Fly Eagles Fly" chant .

title: Where LSU ranks among the open Power 4 jobs
content: all four power conferences have had a firing in the first half of the season . the u.s. has a combined record of 298-150 in the FBS . there are eight power 4 schools looking for head coaches .
